Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, A.5373A/S.4735B, known as the Protect Our Schools Act, in relation to protecting students, faculty and staff from civil arrest while attending or participating in school activities
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Adopted by the Committee on Education
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Farías) called for a voice vote.  Hearing those in favor, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Farías) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

The following 8 Council Members formally noted their intention to vote in the negative against this item: 
Council Members Carr, Gennaro, Holden, Marmorato, Morano, Paladino, Vernikov, and the Minority Leader (Council Member Ariola).

Adopted by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by voice vote.
Items.MatterName: Protect Our Schools Act. (A.5373-A/S.4735-B)

INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS

Pursuant to Section 33-a of the New York City Charter, the New York City Council may vote on the following items no earlier than 30 days from the date of this notice. The New York City Council reserves the right to vote without the notice required pursuant to Section 33-a on any proposed local laws that do not relate to the public safety operations of the New York City Police Department, the Fire Department or the Department of Correction.
Items.AgendaNote: INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS - Pursuant to Section 33-a of the New York City Charter, the New York City Council may vote on the following items no earlier than 30 days from the date of this notice. The New York City Council reserves the right to vote without the notice required pursuant to Section 33-a on any proposed local laws that do not relate to the public safety operations of the New York City Police Department, the Fire Department or the Department of Correction.

Items.MinutesNote: The Majority Leader (Council Member Farías) presiding as the President Pro Tempore.

The presence of a quorum was announced by the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Farías).

There were 48 Council Members marked present at the Stated Meeting.

There is one vacant seat in the Council pending the swearing-in of the certified winner of the November 4, 2025 General Election for the 2nd Council District in Manhattan.

The Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Farías) put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such reports, which were decided in the affirmative by the following vote:

The following files were removed from the General Orders Calendar and voted separately:
 
Int. No. 429-A,  VOTE: 47-1-0
Negative: Council Member Riley.

Int. No. 621-A,  VOTE: 47-1-0
Negative: Council Member Paladino.

Int. No. 780-A,  VOTE: 42-6-0
Negative: Council Members Carr, Marmorato, Morano, Paladino, Vernikov, and the Minority Leader (Council Member Ariola).

Int. No. 1271-A,  VOTE: 41-7-0
Negative: Council Members Carr, Holden, Marmorato, Morano, Paladino, Vernikov, and the Minority Leader (Council Member Ariola).

Preconsidered Res. No. 1059,  VOTE: 41-7-0
Negative:  Council Members Carr, Holden, Marmorato, Morano, Paladino, Vernikov, and the Minority Leader (Council Member Ariola).

L.U. No. 347 & Res. No. 1078,  VOTE: 37-8-3
Negative:  Council Members Carr, Felder, Hanks, Holden,  Morano, Paladino, Vernikov, and the Minority Leader (Council Member Ariola).
Abstentions: Council Members Lee, Narcisse, and Zhuang.

L.U. No. 348 & Res. No. 1079,  VOTE: 36-8-4
Negative: Council Members Carr, Felder, Hanks, Holden, Morano, Paladino, Vernikov, and the Minority Leader (Council Member Ariola).
Abstentions: Council Members Dinowitz, Lee, Narcisse, and Zhuang.

L.U. No. 363 & Res. No. 1074,  VOTE: 36-9-3
Negative: Council Members Carr, Hanks, Holden, Marmorato, Mealy, Morano, Paladino, Vernikov, and the Minority Leader (Council Member Ariola).
Abstentions: Council Members Lee, Marte, and Zhuang.

See files for individual votes.
At this point the Speaker (Council Member Adams) made the following announcements:

Whereupon on motion of the Speaker (Council Member Adams), the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Farías) adjourned these proceedings to meet again for the Stated Meeting of Thursday, October 9, 2025.

ALISSA FUENTES, Acting City Clerk
Acting Clerk of the Council
